metadata.titleEn: LA-ICP-MS data of sphalerite from Lishan Pb Zn Cu polymetallic deposit, Hunan Province
metadata.description:
The data set is LA-ICP-MS data of Sphalerite in Lishan Pb Zn Cu polymetallic deposit, Hunan Province. The experimental method was la-icp-ms. The test analysis was completed in Nanjing poly spectrum testing technology Co., Ltd. The 193 nm ArF excimer laser ablation system is manufactured by Teledyne CETAC technologies, and its model is analyte excite; The model of Quadrupole Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer (ICP-MS) is Agilent 7700x. The deep UV beam generated by the excimer laser generator is focused on the sulfide surface through the homogenized optical path, the energy density is 3.5 J / cm2, and the beam spot diameter is 25 ~ 40 μ m. The frequency is 6 Hz and the ablation time is 40 seconds. The tested elements include 55Mn, 57Fe, 59Co, 60Ni, 65Cu, 66zn, 69Ga, 72ge, 75as, 77Se, 107ag, 111Cd, 118sn, 121Sb and 125Te. The calibration of trace elements was carried out by using the U.S. Geological Survey sulfide briquette mass-1 and basaltic molten glass gse-1g, and the data processing was completed by using the software icpmsdata cal. This data can provide data support for future geochemical model analysis of Lishan Pb Zn Cu polymetallic deposit in Hunan Province.
The above data have been published in EI high-level journals, and the data are true and reliable. The data is stored in Excel.
metadata.instructions: The data were stored in Excel format. The sample name is "YY DD ZZ", where YY represents the sampling location and DD ZZ represents the sample number.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to analyze trace elements in sulfide minerals within polymetallic deposits?
Example.Answer: A data collection method used to analyze trace elements in sulfide minerals within polymetallic deposits is the laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS). This method involves using a 193 nm ArF excimer laser ablation system to generate deep ultraviolet beams that ablate the surface of the sulfide minerals. The ablation aerosol is then carried by helium gas into an ICP-MS for testing. This technique was used to analyze elements such as Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn, Ga, Ge, As, Se, Ag, Cd, Sn, Sb, and Te in sphalerite from a polymetallic deposit.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key characteristics of a dataset collected using LA-ICP-MS for analyzing mineral compositions in polymetallic ore deposits?
Feature Specification.Answer: 193 nm ArF excimer laser, energy density of 3.5 J/cm², spot size of 25-40 μm, ablation frequency of 6 Hz, duration of 40 seconds, helium transport, elements tested: 55Mn, 57Fe, 59Co, 60Ni, 65Cu, 66Zn, 69Ga, 72Ge, 75As, 77Se, 107Ag, 111Cd, 118Sn, 121Sb, 125Te, calibration with USGS pressed sulfide pellets MASS-1, calibration with basaltic glass GSE-1G, data processing with ICPMSDataCal software

Quantification.Question: How many elements are quantitatively analyzed using LA-ICP-MS in a dataset related to 湖南栗山铅锌铜多金属矿床?

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives of employing LA-ICP-MS technology for collecting data on sphalerite in multi-metallic ore deposits?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objectives of employing LA-ICP-MS technology for collecting data on sphalerite in multi-metallic ore deposits include providing reliable geochemical data to support future geochemical model analysis of the Hunan Lishan lead-zinc-copper polymetallic ore deposits.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What steps are involved in implementing LA-ICP-MS to collect trace element data from sphalerite in polymetallic ore deposits, and how are the results processed and calibrated?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The process involves using a 193 nm ArF excimer laser ablation system manufactured by Teledyne Cetac Technologies, specifically the Analyte Excite model. The deep ultraviolet beam produced by the excimer laser is homogenized and focused on the surface of the sulfide mineral with an energy density of 3.5 J/cm2 and a spot diameter of 25-40 μm at a frequency of 6 Hz. The ablation is conducted for 40 seconds, and the aerosol is transported by helium gas to an Agilent 7700x quadrupole ICP-MS for testing. The elements analyzed include 55Mn, 57Fe, 59Co, 60Ni, 65Cu, 66Zn, 69Ga, 72Ge, 75As, 77Se, 107Ag, 111Cd, 118Sn, 121Sb, and 125Te. Calibration of trace elements is done using USGS sulfide pressed powder standard MASS-1 and basaltic glass standard GSE-1G, and data processing is carried out using the software ICPMSDataCal.

Enablement.Question: What technological methods enable the precise measurement of trace elements in sulfide minerals within polymetallic ore deposits?
Enablement.Answer: The precise measurement of trace elements in sulfide minerals within polymetallic ore deposits is enabled by the use of LA-ICP-MS (Laser Ablation Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry). This method involves a 193 nm ArF excimer laser ablation system manufactured by Teledyne Cetac Technologies, and an Agilent 7700x quadrupole ICP-MS. The deep UV beam produced by the excimer laser is homogenized and focused on the sulfide surface with an energy density of 3.5 J/cm2, a spot size of 25~40 μm, and a frequency of 6 Hz for 40 seconds. The ablated aerosol is then carried by helium into the ICP-MS for testing.
